alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 PM CDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - According to Montgomery County, the following roadways remain not passable due to high water: Woodwind Circle at Browning Drive, Melville Drive at Emerson Drive, and Andromeda Court at Orion Court. It is noted that as of 7pm CDT, the first two intersections were flooded with several feet of water so this may take a bit of time to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Montgomery County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
